Good for beginners, good for advanced, good for experts. (Good for everyone.) Graphics are good. With the steam workshop you can play community made tests. There are thousands (if not millions) of tests on the steam workshop, any of which you can have fun with. With the addition of the Perpetual Testing Initiative, you can play other people's tests, along with making your own. There is also a more advanced level editor (Outside of the game as a separate app that comes with the game.) that can be used for more complex tests. Because of the workshop there is endless replay value üòÅ. Then there is the Beemod. The Beemod is a community made app that can change the pallet used in the making of tests in-game. It supports a whole bunch of different items all of which can be used for the making of an interesting test. Items added in the Beemod include stand-alone blocks, triggers, doors, logic gates, and more! To summarize: Good game, good graphics, level editor (mod for editor) and a more complex level editor. Endless tests on the workshop. üëç
